TITLE: Handling Bootstrap Modal 'show' Event with jQuery DESCRIPTION: This jQuery snippet illustrates how to hook into the Bootstrap modal's `show.bs.modal` event. It demonstrates preventing the modal from being shown by calling `e.preventDefault()` within the event handler based on a condition (e.g., if `data` is falsy). This allows for conditional display of modals. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $('#myModal').on('show.bs.modal', function (e) { if (!data) { return e.preventDefault() // stops modal from being shown } }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Custom Form Validation in JavaScript with Bootstrap DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code enables custom form validation for Bootstrap forms. It prevents form submission if there are invalid fields and adds the 'was-validated' class to the form after submission attempt. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/components/forms.md#2025-04-23_snippet_20 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // Example starter JavaScript for disabling form submissions if there are invalid fields (function() { 'use strict'; window.addEventListener('load', function() { // Fetch all the forms we want to apply custom Bootstrap validation styles to var forms = document.getElementsByClassName('needs-validation'); // Loop over them and prevent submission var validation = Array.prototype.filter.call(forms, function(form) { form.addEventListener('submit', function(event) { if (form.checkValidity() === false) { event.preventDefault(); event.stopPropagation(); } form.classList.add('was-validated'); }, false); }); }, false); })(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Docker Images for TAK Server Cluster DESCRIPTION: A series of Docker build and push commands to create and publish the necessary Docker images for the TAK Server cluster components. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-cluster/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker build -t docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-base:latest -f docker-files/Dockerfile.takserver-base . docker push docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-base:latest docker build --pull -t docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-messaging:latest -f docker-files/Dockerfile.takserver-messaging --build-arg TAKSERVER_IMAGE_REPO=docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-base --build-arg TAKSERVER_IMAGE_TAG=latest . docker push docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-messaging:latest docker build --pull -t docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-api:latest -f docker-files/Dockerfile.takserver-api --build-arg TAKSERVER_IMAGE_REPO=docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-base --build-arg TAKSERVER_IMAGE_TAG=latest . docker push docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-api:latest docker build --pull -t docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-plugins:latest -f docker-files/Dockerfile.takserver-plugins --build-arg TAKSERVER_IMAGE_REPO=docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-base --build-arg TAKSERVER_IMAGE_TAG=latest . docker push docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-plugins:latest docker build -t docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-database-setup:latest -f docker-files/Dockerfile.database-setup . docker push docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov/takserver-cluster/takserver-database-setup:latest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Preparing TAK Server for Local Development DESCRIPTION: Commands to build TAK Server and set up the required environment variables for local development, including Java 17-specific JVM arguments and Ignite configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd takserver-core ../gradlew clean bootWar bootJar cd example export IGNITE_HOME="$PWD/ignite" export JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS="-Dloader.path=WEB-INF/lib-provided,WEB-INF/lib,WEB-INF/classes,file:lib/ -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Djava.security.egd=file:/dev/./urandom -DIGNITE_UPDATE_NOTIFIER=false -DIGNITE_QUIET=true -Dio.netty.tmpdir=$PWD -Djava.io.tmpdir=$PWD -Dio.netty.native.workdir=$PWD -Djdk.tls.client.protocols=TLSv1.2 --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.pkcs=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.pkcs10=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.util=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.x509=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.tools.keytool=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/jdk.internal.misc=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.nio.ch=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.management/com.sun.jmx.mbeanserver=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=jdk.internal.jvmstat/sun.jvmstat.monitor=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.reflect.generics.reflectiveObjects=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=jdk.management/com.sun.management.internal=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.io=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.nio=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.util=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.util.concurrent=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.util.concurrent.locks=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.util.concurrent.atomic=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.lang.invoke=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.math=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.sql/java.sql=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/javax.net.ssl=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.net=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=jdk.unsupported/sun.misc=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.lang.ref=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.lang.reflect=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.security=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.security.ssl=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/java.security.cert=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.rsa=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.ssl=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.x500=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.pkcs12=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/sun.security.provider=ALL-UNNAMED --add-opens=java.base/javax.security.auth.x500=ALL-UNNAMED" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running PostgreSQL with PostGIS in Docker DESCRIPTION: Commands to run a local PostgreSQL database with PostGIS extension using Docker, configuring necessary environment variables for TAK Server. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -it -d --rm --name TakserverServer0DB \ --env POSTGRES_PASSWORD=e815f795745e \ --env POSTGRES_HOST_AUTH_METHOD=trust \ --env POSTGRES_USER=martiuser \ --env POSTGRES_DB=cot \ -p 5432 postgis/postgis:15-3.3 echo SQL SERVER IP: `docker inspect --format='{{range .NetworkSettings.Networks}}{{.IPAddress}}{{end}}' TakserverServer0DB` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dynamically Updating Bootstrap Modal Content with jQuery (JavaScript) DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet uses jQuery to handle the Bootstrap `show.bs.modal` event. It identifies the button that triggered the modal using `event.relatedTarget`, extracts data from the button's `data-whatever` attribute, and updates the modal's title and an input field within the modal body accordingly. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/components/modal.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $('#exampleModal').on('show.bs.modal', function (event) { var button = $(event.relatedTarget) // Button that triggered the modal var recipient = button.data('whatever') // Extract info from data-* attributes // If necessary, you could initiate an AJAX request here (and then do the updating in a callback). // Update the modal's content. We'll use jQuery here, but you could use a data binding library or other methods instead. var modal = $(this) modal.find('.modal-title').text('New message to ' + recipient) modal.find('.modal-body input').val(recipient) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Bootstrap Starter Template DESCRIPTION: Complete HTML5 starter template incorporating Bootstrap CSS and JS dependencies with proper meta tags for responsive behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` Hello, world!

Hello, world!

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up TAK Server Database Schema DESCRIPTION: Java commands to set up and upgrade the TAK Server database schema using SchemaManager.jar utility. These commands should be run from the /opt/tak/db-utils directory on the TAK Server machine. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-schemamanager/aurora/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -jar SchemaManager.jar SetupRds && java -jar SchemaManager.jar upgrade ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Validating database schema with SchemaManager DESCRIPTION: Java command to validate the database schema on a testing database. This verifies that all migrations would apply cleanly without actually executing them. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-schemamanager/src/main/resources/README.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` java -jar SchemaManager.jar -dbname testing_db validate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Bootstrap via Sass - SCSS Imports DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates two ways to import Bootstrap's SCSS sources in a custom Sass file: (A) import all modules at once; (B) import core and selectively include needed components. Dependencies: Bootstrap SCSS in the referenced paths, Sass compiler. Inputs are import paths; outputs are compiled CSS including Bootstrap styles as customized. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` // Custom.scss\n// Option A: Include all of Bootstrap\n\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/bootstrap"; ``` LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` // Custom.scss\n// Option B: Include parts of Bootstrap\n\n// Required\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/functions";\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/variables";\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/mixins";\n\n// Optional\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/reboot";\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/type";\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/images";\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/code";\n@import "../node_modules/bootstrap/scss/grid"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring gRPC Input on TAK Server - XML DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define a gRPC input section within the TAK Server configuration. This XML snippet requires a TAK Server that supports the gRPC protocol and must be placed within the appropriate configuration file. Key parameters include the authentication method (x509), protocol (grpc), network port (30001), and supported TLS versions. The snippet must be adjusted to match the actual deployment environment as needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/testing/grpc-streaming-cot-client/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying and Extending Bootstrap Sass Maps - SCSS Map Modifications DESCRIPTION: Shows techniques for replacing or adding key-value pairs in Bootstrap Sass maps (e.g., $theme-colors). The first example redefines the map with new colors; the second appends a custom color entry. Useful for customizing theme colors globally. Dependencies: Bootstrap’s SCSS variables and maps. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` $theme-colors: (\n "primary": #0074d9,\n "danger": #ff4136\n); ``` LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` $theme-colors: (\n "custom-color": #900\n); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Color Functions in Sass Selectors - SCSS Function Usage Example DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the custom color and theme-color functions within a CSS selector for dynamic theming. The .custom-element selector applies a color from $grays and a background-color from $theme-colors. Input: selectors with function calls. Output: CSS rules with color values. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` .custom-element {\n color: gray("100");\n background-color: theme-color("dark");\n} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TAK Server Kubernetes Deployment with Helm DESCRIPTION: Series of kubectl and helm commands to deploy TAK Server and its dependencies to a Kubernetes cluster. Includes creating config maps for certificates, setting up docker registry credentials, and managing the helm deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-cluster/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create configmap cert-migration-replacement --from-file="path to pre-generated cluster certs" --dry-run=client -o yaml >cert-migration-replacement.yaml kubectl create -f cert-migration-replacement.yaml -n takserver kubectl create secret -n takserver docker-registry reg-cred --docker-server=docker-devtest-local.artifacts.tak.gov --docker-username=${ARTIFACTORY_USERNAME} --docker-password=${ARTIFACTORY_PASSWORD} helm dep update helm upgrade --install takserver -n=takserver --create-namespace ./ -f ./production-values.yaml helm uninstall takserver -n takserver ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Basic Bootstrap Navbar with Responsive Collapse DESCRIPTION: Example of a complete responsive navbar implementation with branding, navigation links, dropdown menu, and search form. The navbar collapses at the lg (large) breakpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/components/navbar.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
Navbar
  • Home (current)
  • Link
  • Dropdown
    Action Another action
    Something else here
  • Disabled
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including Bootstrap JavaScript Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Adding required JavaScript dependencies (jQuery, Popper.js, and Bootstrap JS) near the end of the HTML document. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/introduction.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Button Examples DESCRIPTION: Examples of basic Bootstrap button styles including predefined color variants and link buttons. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/components/buttons.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting TAK Server Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: Command to start the TAK server using docker-compose, which will configure and run the container based on the compose file settings SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/docker/full/full-README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker-compose up ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Specific Column Sizing in Bootstrap Forms (HTML) DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to structure a form row using Bootstrap's grid system. It uses `.form-row` for a more compact layout than a standard `.row`. Inside, `.col-7` allocates a specific width (7 out of 12 columns) to the first input, while the remaining two `.col` elements automatically share the remaining space equally. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/components/forms.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose TAK Server Launch Command DESCRIPTION: Command to start the TAK Server containers using Docker Compose. Can be run in foreground or background mode with -d flag. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/docker/hardened/full/hardened-full-README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker compose -f docker/docker-compose.yml up ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building TAK Server Docker Container DESCRIPTION: Command to build the TAK server Docker container using the Dockerfile.takserver file and tagging it as takserver-full:latest SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/docker/full/full-README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker build --file Dockerfile.takserver --tag takserver-full:latest ../ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comprehensive Angular-Gantt Data Example DESCRIPTION: Complete example of scope data definition for angular-gantt showing multiple rows, tasks with various configurations, parent-child relationships, and custom styling. Demonstrates all available features of the data attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-gantt/docs/configuration/data.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $scope.data = [{name: 'Milestones', height: '3em', sortable: false, classes: 'gantt-row-milestone', color: '#45607D', tasks: [ // Dates can be specified as string, timestamp or javascript date object. The data attribute can be used to attach a custom object {name: 'Kickoff', color: '#93C47D', from: '2013-10-07T09:00:00', to: '2013-10-07T10:00:00', data: 'Can contain any custom data or object'}, {name: 'Concept approval', color: '#93C47D', from: new Date(2013, 9, 18, 18, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 18, 18, 0, 0), est: new Date(2013, 9, 16, 7, 0, 0), lct: new Date(2013, 9, 19, 0, 0, 0)}, {name: 'Development finished', color: '#93C47D', from: new Date(2013, 10, 15, 18, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 15, 18, 0, 0)}, {name: 'Shop is running', color: '#93C47D', from: new Date(2013, 10, 22, 12, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 22, 12, 0, 0)}, {name: 'Go-live', color: '#93C47D', from: new Date(2013, 10, 29, 16, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 29, 16, 0, 0)} ], data: 'Can contain any custom data or object'}, {name: 'Status meetings', tasks: [ {name: 'Demo #1', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 9, 25, 15, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 25, 18, 30, 0)}, {name: 'Demo #2', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 10, 1, 15, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 1, 18, 0, 0)}, {name: 'Demo #3', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 10, 8, 15, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 8, 18, 0, 0)}, {name: 'Demo #4', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 10, 15, 15, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 15, 18, 0, 0)}, {name: 'Demo #5', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 10, 24, 9, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 24, 10, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Kickoff', movable: {allowResizing: false}, tasks: [ {name: 'Day 1', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 9, 7, 9, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 7, 17, 0, 0), progress: {percent: 100, color: '#3C8CF8'}, movable: false}, {name: 'Day 2', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 9, 8, 9, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 8, 17, 0, 0), progress: {percent: 100, color: '#3C8CF8'}}, {name: 'Day 3', color: '#9FC5F8', from: new Date(2013, 9, 9, 8, 30, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 9, 12, 0, 0), progress: {percent: 100, color: '#3C8CF8'}} ]}, {name: 'Create concept', tasks: [ {name: 'Create concept', content: ' {{task.model.name}}', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 9, 10, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 16, 18, 0, 0), est: new Date(2013, 9, 8, 8, 0, 0), lct: new Date(2013, 9, 18, 20, 0, 0), progress: 100} ]}, {name: 'Finalize concept', tasks: [ {name: 'Finalize concept', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 9, 17, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 18, 18, 0, 0), progress: 100} ]}, {name: 'Development', children: ['Sprint 1', 'Sprint 2', 'Sprint 3', 'Sprint 4'], content: ' {{row.model.name}}'}, {name: 'Sprint 1', tooltips: false, tasks: [ {name: 'Product list view', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 9, 21, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 9, 25, 15, 0, 0), progress: 25} ]}, {name: 'Sprint 2', tasks: [ {name: 'Order basket', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 9, 28, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 1, 15, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Sprint 3', tasks: [ {name: 'Checkout', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 4, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 8, 15, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Sprint 4', tasks: [ {name: 'Login & Signup & Admin Views', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 11, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 15, 15, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Hosting'}, {name: 'Setup', tasks: [ {name: 'HW', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 18, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 18, 12, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Config', tasks: [ {name: 'SW / DNS/ Backups', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 18, 12, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 21, 18, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Server', parent: 'Hosting', children: ['Setup', 'Config']}, {name: 'Deployment', parent: 'Hosting', tasks: [ {name: 'Depl. & Final testing', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 21, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 22, 12, 0, 0), 'classes': 'gantt-task-deployment'} ]}, {name: 'Workshop', tasks: [ {name: 'On-side education', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 24, 9, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 25, 15, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Content', tasks: [ {name: 'Supervise content creation', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 26, 9, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 29, 16, 0, 0)} ]}, {name: 'Documentation', tasks: [ {name: 'Technical/User documentation', color: '#F1C232', from: new Date(2013, 10, 26, 8, 0, 0), to: new Date(2013, 10, 28, 18, 0, 0)} ]}] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Messaging Microservice for TAK Server DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Messaging microservice which handles message routing and delivery in TAK Server. It includes an Ignite server that the API process may connect to. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -server -XX:+AlwaysPreTouch -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+ScavengeBeforeFullGC -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -Xmx -Dspring.profiles.active=messaging,duplicatelogs -jar ../build/libs/takserver-core-xyz.war ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Tooltip Instance in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to instantiate a new Tooltip object by passing a reference to a DOM element and an options object supporting multiple configuration parameters such as 'placement', 'arrowSelector', 'container', and customization for HTML content. Prerequisites include a DOM environment and optionally jQuery objects and Popper.js for advanced positioning. Inputs include an HTMLElement as reference and an options object (with support for trigger type, delay, template, etc.), while the output is a Tooltip instance. The instance provides programmatic control methods over the tooltip's behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/popper.js/docs/_includes/tooltip-documentation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` // Example usage: const tooltip = new Tooltip(reference, { placement: 'top', arrowSelector: '.tooltip-arrow', container: false, delay: { show: 500, hide: 100 }, html: false, template: '
', title: 'Hello', trigger: 'hover focus', closeOnClickOutside: false, boundariesElement: undefined, offset: 0, popperOptions: {} }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Hardened TAK Server Docker Images - Bash/Gradle DESCRIPTION: This builds a hardened version of the TAK server Docker image by cleaning previous artifacts and invoking the Gradle target buildHardenedDocker. It requires an appropriate Gradle build environment and Docker installed. The output is a more secure/hardened image for TAK server deployments. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/utils/cluster/README_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ../../src ./gradlew clean buildHardenedDocker ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Demonstrating Bootstrap Grid Column Wrapping (HTML) DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the default column wrapping behavior in Bootstrap's 12-column grid. When the sum of column units within a `.row` exceeds 12, the extra columns wrap onto a new line as a contiguous block. Here, `.col-4` wraps because 9 + 4 > 12. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/layout/grid.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
.col-9
.col-4
Since 9 + 4 = 13 > 12, this 4-column-wide div gets wrapped onto a new line as one contiguous unit.
.col-6

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building TAK Server Docker Images from Source - Bash/Gradle DESCRIPTION: This snippet changes directory to the 'src' folder and uses Gradle's wrapper to clean previous builds and create both the main TAK server Docker image and the corresponding certificate authority (CA) image. Requires a working Gradle setup and the relevant Dockerfiles in place. Outputs are Docker images ready to be used for TAK server deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/utils/cluster/README_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ../../src ./gradlew clean buildDocker buildDockerCA ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Provision and Start TAK Server via Shell Script - Bash DESCRIPTION: Executes a shell script to provision and start the TAK server using a prepared shell script. This requires the script file (provision-and-start-docker-takserver.sh) to be present and executable. The operation assumes prebuilt Docker images and establishes necessary containers and configuration for TAK server startup. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/utils/cluster/README_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./provision-and-start-docker-takserver.sh ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Version History for TAK Server 4.5.0 in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the detailed changelog for TAK Server version 4.5.0, including platform updates, admin UX improvements, security enhancements, and various feature additions across different components of the system. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/VERSION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Version History ## 4.5.0 4.5.0 * Platform * Add support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and CentOS 8 * Significant performance improvements * Fix database container restart connectivity issue in docker. See section 4.6 Docker Install * Admin UX * Add new User Management UI for local file-based users. * Added new takserver-esapi.log for intrusion detection messages. These messages were previously in takserver-api.log and are now written to a dedicated log file. * Added persistence for CoT injectors. * In UserManager.jar, add options -ig and -og to UserManager to dynamically specify In groups and Out groups. Fix username / password user deletion logic in UserManager. Update groups dynamically when changed from UserManager. * In UserManager.jar when changing groups for a user, instead of always adding what's specified (group name), require the full list of group to be specified, and add / remove internally to match. This adds support for dynamically removing groups from a user. * On upgrade, preserve existing clear-old-data.sqlscript * Security * Updated default CRL validity period to 2 years, matching default validity of server certificates. * Update tomcat to 9.0.54 to address CVE-2021-42340 Denial of Service see https://us- cert.cisa.gov/ncas/current-activity/2021/10/15/ * Dependencies updates, including Apache Ignite * Support SELinux enforcing mode * Situational Awareness * Added optional user facing web page for submitting location reports, configurable to broadcast or add locations to a mission * Authentication * Add controls for limiting access to a set of ldap groups * Add option to set group name based on DN in CAC/PIV * Allow for concurrent WebTAK logins with same username * Support revocation of client certifications through enrollment, without requiring a server restart. * Data Management * Add feature to support data sync mission archive and retrieval. * TAK Server Plugin SDK * Add new MessageInterceptor plugin type. Plugins of this type intercept messages after they are received by TAK Server from clients or federates, but before the messages are broadcast out to receiving clients. Plugin code can modify or enrich each message that is intercepted. * SDK available here: https://git.tak.gov/sdks/takserver/tak-server-sdk * Federation * Add feature to block files by file-type (such as ATAK .pref files) * Block duplicate connections * WebTAK * Features * added routes tool (receive-only) * delete feed in Data Sync * re-write of Data Sync tool to improve operations * better recognition and notification of lost server connection * ability to reconnect with server without a page refresh * Bugfixes * disabled password autofill on text inputs * Security Patches * n/a ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: RHEL7 System Update and Java 17 Installation DESCRIPTION: Commands to update the system and install Java 17 on RHEL7, which is required for Federation Hub. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/docs/README_fedhub.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo yum update -y sudo yum install wget -y sudo wget https://download.oracle.com/java/17/latest/jdk-17_linux-x64_bin.rpm sudo yum install -y ./jdk-17_linux-x64_bin.rpm ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Named Controller with ngDialog DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code showing how to specify a controller by name when opening a dialog. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/ng-dialog/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` ngDialog.open({ template: 'externalTemplate.html', controller: 'SomeController' }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running and Exposing TAK Server Core via Docker - Docker CLI DESCRIPTION: Runs the provisioned TAK server core in a Docker container named 'takserver-core', attaches it to the 'takserver-net' network, and exposes default TAK server ports to the host system. Requires prior availability of the 'tak/server-core-provisioned:latest' image and that the specified ports are free on the host. The running container is accessible via exposed ports for service communication. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/utils/cluster/README_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run --name takserver-core --network takserver-net -p 8089:8089 -p 8443:8443 -p 8444:8444 -p 8446:8446 -t -d tak/server-core-provisioned:latest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Upgrading database schema with SchemaManager DESCRIPTION: Java command to apply schema upgrades to a testing database. This executes any pending migration scripts against the specified database. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-schemamanager/src/main/resources/README.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` java -jar SchemaManager.jar -dbname testing_db upgrade ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Python Dependencies with requirements.txt - Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet specifies third-party Python libraries using pip requirements syntax, with some entries pinned to specific versions (via '=='). To use it, run 'pip install -r requirements.txt' in the terminal; this will attempt to install all listed packages at the specified versions. Critical for ensuring consistent package versions across development, testing, and deployment environments. Inputs are package names, optionally with version constraints, one per line; no outputs except for dependency resolution and installation by pip. The file should be used at the root of a Python project and may require system-level prerequisites for some packages. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/testing/load_test/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` lxml==4.9.2 protobuf==3.11.3 pyOpenSSL==23.1.1 PyYAML==5.1 requests==2.26 urllib3==1.26 websockets pyzmq==25.0.2 boto3==1.18 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Demonstrating Order Classes in Bootstrap Grid DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use order classes to control the visual order of content in a Bootstrap grid. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-cluster/ManualClusterGuide.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd $CLUSTER_HOME_DIR && docker build -t $AWS_ECR_URI:database-setup -f docker-files/Dockerfile.rds . && docker push $AWS_ECR_URI && kubectl run takserver-database-setup --image=$AWS_ECR_URI:database-setup --image-pull-policy Always --restart Never --env="AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=$AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" --env="AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=$AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID" --env="region=$TAK_CLUSTER_REGION" --env="identifier=$TAK_CLUSTER_NAME" cd $CLUSTER_HOME_DIR && docker build -t $AWS_ECR_URI:core-base -f docker-files/Dockerfile.takserver-base . && docker build -f docker-files/Dockerfile.takserver-core -t $AWS_ECR_URI:core-provisioned . && docker push $AWS_ECR_URI ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Spring Framework Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Collection of Spring Framework core libraries and starters including Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring Data, and Spring Cloud AWS components. Used for building enterprise Java applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/THIRDPARTY.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` org.springframework.boot:spring-boot:2.4.2 org.springframework:spring-core:5.3.3 org.springframework:spring-context:5.3.3 org.springframework.cloud:spring-cloud-starter-aws:2.2.3.RELEASE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing and Calling Bootstrap Modals Programmatically with jQuery DESCRIPTION: This jQuery code showcases different ways to interact with the Bootstrap modal plugin via its JavaScript API. It relies on Docker and the presence of a Dockerfile named Dockerfile.postgres14_postgis3. Required parameters include the Dockerfile path and the desired image tag. The output is a local Docker image used as a prerequisite for TAK server deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/utils/cluster/README_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd utils/cluster docker build -f Dockerfile.postgres14_postgis3 -t tak/postgres14_postgis3:latest . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SELinux for Federation Hub on RHEL8 DESCRIPTION: Commands to add and apply SELinux policies for Federation Hub on RHEL8. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/docs/README_fedhub.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo dnf install checkpolicy cd /opt/tak/federation-hub && sudo ./apply-selinux.sh && sudo semodule -l | grep takserver ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic ngDialog Controller Implementation DESCRIPTION: Basic Angular controller code showing how to inject and use ngDialog service to open a dialog. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/ng-dialog/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var app = angular.module('exampleApp', ['ngDialog']); app.controller('MainCtrl', function ($scope, ngDialog) { $scope.clickToOpen = function () { ngDialog.open({ template: 'popupTmpl.html', className: 'ngdialog-theme-default' }); }; }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Hardened TAK Database Container DESCRIPTION: This command runs the hardened TAK database container, connecting it to the TAKServer network and exposing the PostgreSQL port. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/testing/aws-cli/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ./run_command.sh ~/cdoucett-keypair.pem "pkill python3" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Dismissible Bootstrap Popovers in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration for dismissible popovers using the focus trigger option. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-cluster/ManualClusterGuide.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd $CLUSTER_HOME_DIR && docker build -t ca-setup --build-arg ARG_CA_NAME=$TAK_CA_NAME --build-arg ARG_STATE=$TAK_STATE --build-arg ARG_CITY=$TAK_CITY --build-arg ARG_ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT=$TAK_ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT -f docker-files/Dockerfile.ca . && docker create -it --name ca-setup-container ca-setup && docker cp ca-setup-container:/files $CLUSTER_HOME_DIR/takserver-core/certs/ && docker rm ca-setup-container ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create configmap cert-migration --from-file="path to pre-generated cluster certs" --dry-run=client -o yaml >cert-migration-replacement.yaml ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create -f cert-migration-replacement.yaml -n takserver ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running CA Setup Hardened Container for TAKServer DESCRIPTION: This command runs the ca-setup-hardened container in detached mode for certificate generation. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/docker/hardened/README_hardened_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker run --name ca-setup-hardened -it -d ca-setup-hardened ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes Management Commands for TAK Server DESCRIPTION: Various kubectl commands for managing and monitoring the TAK Server cluster, including log viewing, service inspection, and scaling deployments. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running API Microservice for TAK Server DESCRIPTION: Command to run the API microservice which provides REST endpoints for interacting with TAK Server. It may connect to the Ignite server running in the messaging process. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -server -XX:+AlwaysPreTouch -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+ScavengeBeforeFullGC -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -Xmx -Dspring.profiles.active=api,duplicatelogs -Dkeystore.pkcs12.legacy -jar ../build/libs/takserver-core-xyz.war ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Copying Required TAKServer Certificates DESCRIPTION: This series of commands ensures that the required TAKServer certificates are available to the TAKServer container. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/docker/hardened/README_hardened_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` [ -d tak/certs/files ] || mkdir tak/certs/files \ && docker cp ca-setup-hardened:/tak/certs/files/takserver.jks tak/certs/files/ \ && docker cp ca-setup-hardened:/tak/certs/files/truststore-root.jks tak/certs/files/ \ && docker cp ca-setup-hardened:/tak/certs/files/fed-truststore.jks tak/certs/files/ \ && docker cp ca-setup-hardened:/tak/certs/files/admin.pem tak/certs/files/ \ && docker cp ca-setup-hardened:/tak/certs/files/config-takserver.cfg tak/certs/files/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Plugin Manager Microservice for TAK Server DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Plugin Manager microservice which is optional but useful when working on plugin capabilities for TAK Server. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` java -server -XX:+AlwaysPreTouch -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+ScavengeBeforeFullGC -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -Xmx -jar ../../takserver-plugin-manager/build/libs/takserver-plugin-manager-xyz.jar ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Flot Series Display Options in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the full structure of the Flot series configuration object and specifies the available options for controlling the visual appearance of lines, points, and bars. Each property within 'series'—including display toggles, sizing, fill styles, and alignment—can be applied globally or per data series. Inputs include booleans, numbers, and color/gradient definitions; outputs affect rendering of chart series. Dependence on the Flot plotting library is required. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` series: { lines, points, bars: { show: boolean lineWidth: number fill: boolean or number fillColor: null or color/gradient } lines, bars: { zero: boolean } points: { radius: number symbol: "circle" or function } bars: { barWidth: number align: "left", "right" or "center" horizontal: boolean } lines: { steps: boolean } shadowSize: number highlightColor: color or number } colors: [ color1, color2, ... ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Getting Admin Certificate Fingerprint for TAKServer DESCRIPTION: This command retrieves the MD5 fingerprint of the admin certificate from the ca-setup-hardened container. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/docker/hardened/README_hardened_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker exec -it ca-setup-hardened bash -c "openssl x509 -noout -fingerprint -md5 -inform pem -in files/admin.pem | grep -oP 'MD5 Fingerprint=\K.*'" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes Cluster Creation with KOPS DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and validating a Kubernetes cluster using KOPS in AWS. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-cluster/ManualClusterGuide.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export KOPS_STATE_STORE=$KOPS_STATE_STORE && $(aws ecr get-login --no-include-email) && kops create cluster --zones $TAK_CLUSTER_ZONES --node-size=m4.xlarge $TAK_CLUSTER_NAME.$TAK_CLUSTER_DOMAIN_NAME --node-count= kops update cluster --name $TAK_CLUSTER_NAME.$TAK_CLUSTER_DOMAIN_NAME --yes kops validate cluster ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Input Fields in Input Group DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement multiple input fields within a single input group, with shared addons or labels. Place this rule within the 'module.rules' array in your webpack.config.js. Requires installation of all referenced loaders, and applies the processing pipeline to files matching the .scss extension. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/webpack.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` ... { test: /\.(scss)$/, use: [{ loader: 'style-loader', // inject CSS to page }, { loader: 'css-loader', // translates CSS into CommonJS modules }, { loader: 'postcss-loader', // Run postcss actions options: { plugins: function () { // postcss plugins, can be exported to postcss.config.js return [ require('autoprefixer') ]; } } }, { loader: 'sass-loader' // compiles Sass to CSS }] }, ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring TAKServer Database Connection in XML DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet shows how to update the database connection URL in the CoreConfig.xml file for TAKServer. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Component Modifiers and Utilities with Bootstrap Sass Loops (SCSS) DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how Bootstrap utilizes Sass `@each` loops iterating over the `$theme-colors` map. The first loop generates modifier classes for alerts (e.g., `.alert-primary`, `.alert-danger`) using the `alert-variant` mixin. The second loop generates background color utility classes (e.g., `.bg-primary`, `.bg-danger`) using the `bg-variant` mixin. Depends on the `$theme-colors` map and associated mixins (`alert-variant`, `bg-variant`, `theme-color-level`) defined within Bootstrap. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` // Generate alert modifier classes @each $color, $value in $theme-colors { .alert-#{$color} { @include alert-variant(theme-color-level($color, -10), theme-color-level($color, -9), theme-color-level($color, 6)); } } // Generate `.bg-*` color utilities @each $color, $value in $theme-colors { @include bg-variant('.bg-#{$color}', $value); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML for Bootstrap Tooltip on Disabled Button DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to implement a tooltip on a disabled button using a wrapper element to maintain accessibility and functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/components/tooltips.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Viewing TAKServer Logs in Docker Container DESCRIPTION: This command allows viewing the TAKServer log file inside the Docker container using tail. It shows the creation of a new Popper instance with custom modifiers. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Series Types and Coloring with Flot in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases a concrete JavaScript example configuring Flot to display both lines and points with specified fill and color properties. The 'lines.show' and 'points.show' toggles activate the respective series types, and 'fillColor' defines a custom line fill using RGBA. This configuration expects Flot as a dependency and is typically passed as the 'options' object to $.plot; input is a standard Flot options object, and the output is an effect on how the data series render. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` var options = { series: { lines: { show: true, fill: true, fillColor: "rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.8)" }, points: { show: true, fill: false } } }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Auto-Sizing with Custom Bootstrap Form Controls (HTML) DESCRIPTION: This example illustrates how to use Bootstrap's auto-sizing column class (`.col-auto`) within a form row (`.form-row`) that contains custom form controls. It includes a custom select (`.custom-select`) and a custom checkbox (`.custom-control`). Utility classes like `.align-items-center`, `.my-1`, and `.mr-sm-2` are used for alignment and spacing. This prevents Bootstrap plugins from being initialized or controlled via HTML data attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $(document).off('.data-api') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring UI Router States DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration for setting up nested states, routes, and controllers using $stateProvider. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-ui-router/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` myApp.config(function($stateProvider, $urlRouterProvider) { // // For any unmatched url, redirect to /state1 $urlRouterProvider.otherwise("/state1"); // // Now set up the states $stateProvider .state('state1', { url: "/state1", templateUrl: "partials/state1.html" }) .state('state1.list', { url: "/list", templateUrl: "partials/state1.list.html", controller: function($scope) { $scope.items = ["A", "List", "Of", "Items"]; } }) .state('state2', { url: "/state2", templateUrl: "partials/state2.html" }) .state('state2.list', { url: "/list", templateUrl: "partials/state2.list.html", controller: function($scope) { $scope.things = ["A", "Set", "Of", "Things"]; } }); }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Popper Instance for DOM Elements - JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code initializes a Popper.js instance to place a popper element next to a reference element. It first selects the elements using document.querySelector, then constructs a new Popper object with the selected nodes and an options object for configuration. Dependencies are Popper.js and the presence of properly marked DOM nodes; parameters reference and popper are HTMLElement objects. The output is a Popper.js instance managing popper positioning, and customization is possible through the options parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/popper.js/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` var reference = document.querySelector('.my-button');\nvar popper = document.querySelector('.my-popper');\nvar popperInstance = new Popper(reference, popper, {\n // popper options here\n}); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Form Validation Tooltips in Bootstrap DESCRIPTION: HTML structure for a form with validation tooltips, including fields for name, username, city, state and zip. TITLE: Bootstrap Grid Sass Mixins
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the Sass mixins used to generate the Bootstrap grid. It includes mixins for creating rows, columns, and offsets.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/layout/grid.md#2025-04-23_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// Creates a wrapper for a series of columns
@include make-row();

// Make the element grid-ready (applying everything but the width)
@include make-col-ready();
@include make-col($size, $columns: $grid-columns);

// Get fancy by offsetting, or changing the sort order
@include make-col-offset($size, $columns: $grid-columns);
```

TITLE: Generating CA and Certs in Docker Container and Copying Files - Bash/Docker
DESCRIPTION: Runs a Docker container named 'takserver-ca' to generate a root CA and client/server certificates, sets environment variables for certificate details, then copies certificate files back to the host. The snippet requires that the 'tak/server-ca:latest' image is available. Outputs are CA and certificates in the local 'target' directory, used for server security.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/utils/cluster/README_docker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd ../utils/cluster
docker run --name takserver-ca -e STATE=MA -e CITY=Cambridge -e ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT=takorg -w /certs -t -d tak/server-ca:latest /bin/bash -c 'makeRootCa.sh --ca-name DOCKER1 && \
         makeCert.sh server takserver && \ 
         makeCert.sh client user && \ 
         makeCert.sh client admin && \
         bash' && \
  echo 'generating CA and certs for DOCKER1' && \
  sleep 5 && \
  docker cp takserver-ca:/certs/files/. target
```

TITLE: Creating Level-Based Theming with theme-color-level - SCSS Function
DESCRIPTION: Defines a function that lightens or darkens a theme color by mixing with white or black based on the numeric level. Negative levels lighten; positive levels darken. Requires prior definition of $theme-colors and $theme-color-interval. Used for advanced color manipulations in custom themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
@function theme-color-level($color-name: "primary", $level: 0) {\n  $color: theme-color($color-name);\n  $color-base: if($level > 0, #000, #fff);\n  $level: abs($level);\n\n  @return mix($color-base, $color, $level * $theme-color-interval);\n}
```

TITLE: Writing a Custom Modifier for Popper.js Integration (e.g., React) - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates how to write a custom modifier function for Popper.js, disabling the default applyStyle modifier and implementing a custom applyReactStyle modifier. The modifier function receives positioning data, which can be exported to a framework like React for DOM updates. Requires Popper.js and suitable JavaScript framework context. Inputs include reference and popper nodes; outputs are custom style handling via the user-defined function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/popper.js/packages/popper/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
function applyReactStyle(data) {
    // export data in your framework and use its content to apply the style to your popper
};

const reference = document.querySelector('.my-button');
const popper = document.querySelector('.my-popper');
new Popper(reference, popper, {
    modifiers: {
        applyStyle: { enabled: false },
        applyReactStyle: {
            enabled: true,
            fn: applyReactStyle,
            order: 800,
        },
    },
});
```

TITLE: Defining Bootstrap's Default Sanitizer Whitelist in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code displays the default whitelist configuration used by Bootstrap's built-in sanitizer for Tooltips and Popovers. It defines allowed HTML elements and attributes, including a pattern for ARIA attributes, ensuring only safe HTML content is rendered.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
var ARIA_ATTRIBUTE_PATTERN = /^aria-[\w-]*$/i
var DefaultWhitelist = {
  // Global attributes allowed on any supplied element below.
  '*': ['class', 'dir', 'id', 'lang', 'role', ARIA_ATTRIBUTE_PATTERN],
  a: ['target', 'href', 'title', 'rel'],
  area: [],
  b: [],
  br: [],
  col: [],
  code: [],
  div: [],
  em: [],
  hr: [],
  h1: [],
  h2: [],
  h3: [],
  h4: [],
  h5: [],
  h6: [],
  i: [],
  img: ['src', 'alt', 'title', 'width', 'height'],
  li: [],
  ol: [],
  p: [],
  pre: [],
  s: [],
  small: [],
  span: [],
  sub: [],
  sup: [],
  strong: [],
  u: [],
  ul: []
}
```

TITLE: AngularJS Controller Implementation for Datetime Picker
DESCRIPTION: Example controller implementation for managing the datetime picker's open state. Provides a function to open the calendar when the calendar button is clicked, preventing event propagation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/bootstrap-ui-datetime-picker/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
app.controller('MyController', function() {
    var that = this;

    this.isOpen = false;

    this.openCalendar = function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        e.stopPropagation();

        that.isOpen = true;
    };
});
```

TITLE: Mixing Responsive Bootstrap Grid Column Classes (HTML)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to combine different Bootstrap column classes for complex responsive layouts. The first row stacks on mobile (`.col-12`, `.col-6`) and adjusts at the medium breakpoint (`.col-md-8`, `.col-md-4`). The second row starts at 50% width (`.col-6`) and changes to 33.3% (`.col-md-4`) on medium screens. The third row maintains 50% width (`.col-6`) across all sizes.

TITLE: Implementing a Row Filter in Angular-Gantt
DESCRIPTION: Example of registering a custom function to filter rows and properly cleaning it up when the scope is destroyed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-gantt/docs/configuration/api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
filter = function(rows) {
  rows.pop();
  return rows;
}

api.rows.addRowFilter(filter);

$scope.$on('$destroy', function() {
  api.rows.removeRowFilter(filter);
};
```

TITLE: Custom Grid Layout Using Bootstrap Sass Mixins
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use Bootstrap's Sass mixins to create a custom two-column layout. It shows the use of make-container, make-row, and make-col mixins.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/layout/grid.md#2025-04-23_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
.example-container {
  width: 800px;
  @include make-container();
}

.example-row {
  @include make-row();
}

.example-content-main {
  @include make-col-ready();

  @include media-breakpoint-up(sm) {
    @include make-col(6);
  }
  @include media-breakpoint-up(lg) {
    @include make-col(8);
  }
}

.example-content-secondary {
  @include make-col-ready();

  @include media-breakpoint-up(sm) {
    @include make-col(6);
  }
  @include media-breakpoint-up(lg) {
    @include make-col(4);
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining Color Utility Functions - Bootstrap SCSS Color Functions
DESCRIPTION: Declares reusable Sass functions to access color values in Bootstrap’s $colors, $theme-colors, and $grays maps. Each function takes a key and returns the color using map-get. Dependencies: Corresponding color maps defined earlier in the SCSS stack. Inputs: key strings such as 'primary', '100'. Outputs: mapped color values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
@function color($key: "blue") {\n  @return map-get($colors, $key);\n}\n\n@function theme-color($key: "primary") {\n  @return map-get($theme-colors, $key);\n}\n\n@function gray($key: "100") {\n  @return map-get($grays, $key);\n}
```

TITLE: Initializing Angular UUID4 Module and Using in Factory
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to add the uuid4 module to an Angular app and use it in a factory to generate unique identifiers. It shows the basic setup and a sample function that generates a UUID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-uuid4/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// add the uuid4 module to your app
myapp = angular.module('myapp', ['uuid4']);

// inject it into your component
myapp.factory('FancyFactory', function(uuid4){
  return {
    codeThatNeedsUUID: function() {
      return "Look ma! I'm unique: " + uuid4.generate();
    }
  };
});
```

TITLE: Multiple Named Views Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring multiple named views with UI Router using state configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-ui-router/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
myApp.config(function($stateProvider) {
  $stateProvider
    .state('index', {
      url: "",
      views: {
        "viewA": { template: "index.viewA" },
        "viewB": { template: "index.viewB" }
      }
    })
    .state('route1', {
      url: "/route1",
      views: {
        "viewA": { template: "route1.viewA" },
        "viewB": { template: "route1.viewB" }
      }
    })
    .state('route2', {
      url: "/route2",
      views: {
        "viewA": { template: "route2.viewA" },
        "viewB": { template: "route2.viewB" }
      }
    })
});
```

CODE:
```
/**
 * TitleFunction example for Tooltip options
 * @returns {String} placement - The desired title
 */
function dynamicTitle() {
  return 'Dynamic tooltip content based on context: ' + this.someProperty;
}
```

TITLE: Defining Custom Intervals for Bootstrap Carousel Items in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet illustrates how to configure varying display durations for individual slides in a Bootstrap carousel. By adding the `data-interval` attribute to specific `.carousel-item` elements (e.g., `data-interval="10000"` for 10 seconds, `data-interval="2000"` for 2 seconds), you override the default carousel interval for those specific items. Items without this attribute use the carousel's default interval. Requires Bootstrap's CSS for styling and JavaScript component for functionality. The `{% include ... %}` tags are likely part of a static site generator templating system (like Jekyll) used for embedding placeholder content.

TITLE: Implementing a Row Sorter in Angular-Gantt
DESCRIPTION: Example of registering a custom function to sort rows and properly cleaning it up when the scope is destroyed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-gantt/docs/configuration/api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
sorter = function(rows) {
  return rows.reverse();
}

api.rows.addRowSorter(sorter);

$scope.$on('$destroy', function() {
  api.rows.removeRowSorter(sorter);
};
```

TITLE: Configuring Pre-Close Callback with Inline Function in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up a pre-close callback function using an inline function with a window.confirm call. This prevents the dialog from closing unless the user confirms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/ng-dialog/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ngDialog.open({
    preCloseCallback: function(value) {
        if (confirm('Are you sure you want to close without saving your changes?')) {
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }
});
```

TITLE: Creating Angular.js Directive for Holder.js
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create an Angular.js directive to use Holder.js in Angular projects. This allows for easy integration of Holder.js placeholders in Angular templates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/holderjs/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
angular.module('MyModule').directive('myHolder', function() {
  return {
    link: function(scope, element, attrs) {
      attrs.$set('data-src', attrs.myHolder);
      Holder.run({images:element[0]});
    }
  };
});
```

TITLE: Implementing Asynchronous QUnit Test for Bootstrap Tooltip Component
DESCRIPTION: Example of an asynchronous unit test for Bootstrap's tooltip component using QUnit. The test verifies the tooltip's show functionality and event firing using Sinon spy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/js/tests/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Asynchronous test
QUnit.test('should describe the unit being tested', function (assert) {
  assert.expect(2)
  var done = assert.async()

  var $tooltip = $('
').bootstrapTooltip()
  var tooltipInstance = $tooltip.data('bs.tooltip')
  var spyShow = sinon.spy(tooltipInstance, 'show')

  $tooltip.appendTo('#qunit-fixture')
    .on('shown.bs.tooltip', function () {
      assert.ok(true, '"shown" event was fired after calling "show"')
      assert.ok(spyShow.called, 'show called')
      done()
    })
    .bootstrapTooltip('show')
})
```

TITLE: Bootstrap Media Query Breakpoints
DESCRIPTION: Default media query ranges for responsive breakpoints in Bootstrap's layout system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/layout/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// Extra small devices (portrait phones, less than 576px)
// No media query for `xs` since this is the default in Bootstrap

// Small devices (landscape phones, 576px and up)
@media (min-width: 576px) { ... }

// Medium devices (tablets, 768px and up)
@media (min-width: 768px) { ... }

// Large devices (desktops, 992px and up)
@media (min-width: 992px) { ... }

// Extra large devices (large desktops, 1200px and up)
@media (min-width: 1200px) { ... }
```

TITLE: Creating Debug Plugin for Flot in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: A complete example of a debug plugin for Flot. It demonstrates how to use hooks, handle options, and maintain plot-specific state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/PLUGINS.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
(function ($) {
  function init(plot) {
    var debugLevel = 1;
  
    function checkDebugEnabled(plot, options) {
      if (options.debug) {
        debugLevel = options.debug;
          
        plot.hooks.processDatapoints.push(alertSeries);
      }
    }

    function alertSeries(plot, series, datapoints) {
      var msg = "series " + series.label;
      if (debugLevel > 1)
        msg += " with " + series.data.length + " points";
      alert(msg);
    }
  
    plot.hooks.processOptions.push(checkDebugEnabled);
  }

  var options = { debug: 0 };
  
  $.plot.plugins.push({
      init: init,
      options: options,
      name: "simpledebug",
      version: "0.1"
  });
})(jQuery);
```

TITLE: Custom Date Formatter for Flot Time Axis in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This function formats a timestamp as a date string in the format 'day/month'. It's designed to be used as a custom tick formatter for time series data in Flot charts.

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```

}

TITLE: Configuring TimeFrames and DateFrames
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up complex calendar configurations using TimeFrames and DateFrames for working hours, holidays, and special dates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-gantt/docs/configuration/attributes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```


```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
$scope.timeFrames = {
  day: {
    start: moment('8:00', 'HH:mm'),
    end: moment('20:00', 'HH:mm'),
    working: true,
    default: true
  },
  noon: {
    start: moment('12:00', 'HH:mm'),
    end: moment('13:30', 'HH:mm'),
    magnet: false,
    working: false,
    default: true
  },
  closed: {
    magnet: false,
    working: false
  }
};

$scope.dateFrames = {
  halloween:{
    date: moment('2014-10-31', 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    targets: ['day']
  },
  holidays: {
    start: moment('2014-08-15', 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    end: moment('2014-08-30', 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    targets: ['closed']
  },
  weekend: {
    evaluator: function(date) {
      return date.isoWeekday() === 6 || date.isoWeekday() === 7;
    },
    targets: ['closed']
  }
};
```

TITLE: Configuring Flot Chart Grid and Interaction Options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the available configuration options for customizing the grid and interaction settings in a Flot chart. It includes properties for controlling the grid's appearance, borders, markings, and interactive behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
grid: {
    show: boolean
    aboveData: boolean
    color: color
    backgroundColor: color/gradient or null
    margin: number or margin object
    labelMargin: number
    axisMargin: number
    markings: array of markings or (fn: axes -> array of markings)
    borderWidth: number or object with "top", "right", "bottom" and "left" properties with different widths
    borderColor: color or null or object with "top", "right", "bottom" and "left" properties with different colors
    minBorderMargin: number or null
    clickable: boolean
    hoverable: boolean
    autoHighlight: boolean
    mouseActiveRadius: number
}

interaction: {
    redrawOverlayInterval: number or -1
}
```

TITLE: Bootstrap Sass Media Query Mixins
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using Bootstrap's Sass mixins for responsive breakpoints, including a practical example of showing/hiding content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/layout/overview.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// No media query necessary for xs breakpoint as it's effectively `@media (min-width: 0) { ... }`
@include media-breakpoint-up(sm) { ... }
@include media-breakpoint-up(md) { ... }
@include media-breakpoint-up(lg) { ... }
@include media-breakpoint-up(xl) { ... }

// Example: Hide starting at `min-width: 0`, and then show at the `sm` breakpoint
.custom-class {
  display: none;
}
@include media-breakpoint-up(sm) {
  .custom-class {
    display: block;
  }
}
```

TITLE: Extending Bootstrap's Sanitizer Whitelist with jQuery
DESCRIPTION: This jQuery code shows how to extend the default sanitizer whitelist used by Bootstrap's Tooltip and Popover plugins. It retrieves the default whitelist, adds new allowed elements (`table`) and attributes (`data-option` for `td`), and pushes a custom regular expression to allow specific data attributes on any element.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
var myDefaultWhiteList = $.fn.tooltip.Constructor.Default.whiteList

// To allow table elements
myDefaultWhiteList.table = []

// To allow td elements and data-option attributes on td elements
myDefaultWhiteList.td = ['data-option']

// You can push your custom regex to validate your attributes.
// Be careful about your regular expressions being too lax
var myCustomRegex = /^data-my-app-[\w-]+/
myDefaultWhiteList['*'].push(myCustomRegex)
```

TITLE: Implementing Nested Confirm Dialog as Pre-Close Callback in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use a nested confirm dialog as a pre-close callback. This example opens a new confirmation dialog before closing the parent dialog.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/ng-dialog/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ngDialog.open({
    preCloseCallback: function(value) {
        var nestedConfirmDialog = ngDialog.openConfirm({
            template:'\\n                
Are you sure you want to close the parent dialog?
\\n                
\\n                    \\n                    \\n                
',
            plain: true
        });

        // NOTE: return the promise from openConfirm
        return nestedConfirmDialog;
    }
});
```

TITLE: Grid Markings Function Example in Flot
DESCRIPTION: Function that generates vertical stripe markings for a Flot chart grid background.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/API.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
markings: function (axes) {
  var markings = [];
  for (var x = Math.floor(axes.xaxis.min); x < axes.xaxis.max; x += 2)
    markings.push({ xaxis: { from: x, to: x + 1 } });
  return markings;
}
```

TITLE: Handling Asynchronous Bootstrap Carousel Transitions with jQuery
DESCRIPTION: This jQuery code illustrates the asynchronous nature of Bootstrap's programmatic API methods and how calls are handled during transitions. It shows binding to the `slid.bs.carousel` event to trigger an action after a slide transition completes. It also demonstrates that calling a method (like `carousel('2')`) while another transition (`carousel('1')`) is in progress will be ignored.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
$('#myCarousel').on('slid.bs.carousel', function (e) {
  $('#myCarousel').carousel('2') // Will slide to the slide 2 as soon as the transition to slide 1 is finished
})

$('#myCarousel').carousel('1') // Will start sliding to the slide 1 and returns to the caller
$('#myCarousel').carousel('2') // !! Will be ignored, as the transition to the slide 1 is not finished !!
```

The snippet requires the presence of corresponding responsive CSS utility classes in the project\'s stylesheet (as with Bootstrap or a similar CSS framework). Inputs are HTML markup with class attributes specifying float behavior at specific breakpoints, and outputs are elements that float accordingly at those viewport sizes or wider. TITLE: Using Angular-Gantt API Events and Methods
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the pattern for listening to events and calling methods using the API object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/angular-gantt/docs/configuration/api.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Listen an event called 'eventName' of a feature called 'featureName'.
api.featureName.on.eventName($scope, function(data) {
    // Called when 'eventName' is raised.
});

// Raise an event called 'eventName' of a feature called 'featureName'.
api.featureName.raise.eventName(data);

// Call method called 'methodName' of a feature called 'featureName'.
api.featureName.methodName();
```

TITLE: Defining Clearfix SCSS Mixin
DESCRIPTION: SCSS mixin definition for clearfix and example of how to include it in an element. The mixin creates a pseudo-element that clears floated content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/utilities/clearfix.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// Mixin itself
@mixin clearfix() {
  &::after {
    display: block;
    content: "";
    clear: both;
  }
}

// Usage as a mixin
.element {
  @include clearfix;
}
```

TITLE: Customizing Embed Aspect Ratios using SCSS Variables
DESCRIPTION: This SCSS code snippet shows the definition of the `$embed-responsive-aspect-ratios` variable, typically found in `_variables.scss`. This variable is a list of ratio pairs (width height) that determines which aspect ratio utility classes (like `.embed-responsive-16by9`) are generated. Modifying this list allows developers to customize the available aspect ratios. The `!default` flag indicates that this value can be overridden in custom SCSS files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/utilities/embed.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
$embed-responsive-aspect-ratios: (
  (21 9),
  (16 9),
  (4 3),
  (1 1)
) !default;
```

TITLE: Custom Point Symbol Function in Flot
DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a custom cross symbol drawing function for point markers in Flot charts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/API.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function cross(ctx, x, y, radius, shadow) {
    var size = radius * Math.sqrt(Math.PI) / 2;
    ctx.moveTo(x - size, y - size);
    ctx.lineTo(x + size, y + size);
    ctx.moveTo(x - size, y + size);
    ctx.lineTo(x + size, y - size);
}
```

TITLE: Documenting Asynchronous Methods and Transitions in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses Liquid templating to create a callout section in Markdown. It explains the asynchronous nature of API methods, their relationship with transitions, and provides a link to more detailed JavaScript documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/_includes/callout-danger-async-methods.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{% capture callout %}
#### Asynchronous methods and transitions

All API methods are **asynchronous** and start a **transition**. They return to the caller as soon as the transition is started but **before it ends**. In addition, a method call on a **transitioning component will be ignored**.

[See our JavaScript documentation for more information]({{ site.baseurl }}/docs/{{ site.docs_version }}/getting-started/javascript/).
{% endcapture %}
{% include callout.html content=callout type="danger" %}
```

TITLE: Defining No-Gutters Style in Bootstrap (SASS)
DESCRIPTION: Provides the SASS source code for the Bootstrap `.no-gutters` utility class. This class removes the default negative margins from the `.row` and the horizontal padding from its direct child columns (`.col` or elements with classes containing `col-`), effectively eliminating the space (gutters) between columns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/layout/grid.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: sass
CODE:
```
.no-gutters {
  margin-right: 0;
  margin-left: 0;

  > .col,
  > [class*="col-"] {
    padding-right: 0;
    padding-left: 0;
  }
}
```

TITLE: Generating Responsive Order Utility Classes with Liquid
DESCRIPTION: This Liquid snippet uses nested loops to generate markdown list items for Bootstrap's responsive order utility classes. It iterates through each breakpoint (`bp`) defined in `site.data.breakpoints` and then through order numbers from 0 to 12 (`i`). This creates class names like `.order-sm-0`, `.order-md-5`, `.order-lg-12`, etc., allowing for different visual ordering at various screen sizes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/utilities/flex.md#2025-04-23_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: liquid
CODE:
```
{% for bp in site.data.breakpoints %}{% for i in (0..12) %}
- `.order{{ bp.abbr }}-{{ i }}`{% endfor %}{% endfor %}
```
