TITLE: Implementing processDatapoints Hook in Flot
DESCRIPTION: Example of implementing the processDatapoints hook that transforms data points before finding min/max values. This specific example shows how to multiply all y coordinates by 2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/API.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function multiply(plot, series, datapoints) {
    var points = datapoints.points, ps = datapoints.pointsize;
    for (var i = 0; i < points.length; i += ps)
        points[i + 1] *= 2;
}
```

# Change Log
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

## [v0.13.1][v0.13.1] (2015-09-29)
### Fixed
- Remove hardcoded source name when using (key,value) syntax [#1217](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1217)
- Modify regex to accept a full 'collection expression' when not using (key,value) syntax [#1216](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1216)
- Avoid to recalculate position when set 'down' [#1214](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/issues/1214#issuecomment-144271352)

## [v0.13.0][v0.13.0] (2015-09-29)
### Added
- Allow to configure default dropdown position [#1213](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1213) 
- Can use object as source with (key,value) syntax [#1208](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1208) 
- CHANGELOG.md file created

### Changed
- Do not run bower after install automatically [#982](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/982)
- Avoid setting activeItem on mouseenter to improve performance [#1211](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1211)

### Fixed
- Position dropdown UP or DOWN correctly depending on the available space [#1212](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1212)
- Scroll to selected item [#976](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/issues/976)
- Change `autocomplete='off'` to `autocomplete='false'` [#1210](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1210)
- Fix to work correctly with debugInfoEnabled(false) [#1131](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1131)
- Limit the maximum number of selections allowed in multiple mode [#1110](https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/pull/1110)

[v0.13.1]: https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/compare/v0.13.0...v0.13.1
[v0.13.0]: https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-select/compare/v0.12.1...v0.13.0
```

TITLE: Resolving Bootstrap Plugin Conflicts with jQuery `.noConflict()`
DESCRIPTION: This jQuery snippet shows how to use the `.noConflict()` method to prevent namespace collisions between Bootstrap's button plugin and potentially other UI frameworks that might use `$.fn.button`. It reverts `$.fn.button` to its previous value and assigns the Bootstrap button functionality to a new namespace (`$.fn.bootstrapBtn`).
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
var bootstrapButton = $.fn.button.noConflict() // return $.fn.button to previously assigned value
$.fn.bootstrapBtn = bootstrapButton // give $().bootstrapBtn the Bootstrap functionality
```

TITLE: Defining a Custom Point Symbol Function for Flot in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a JavaScript function to be used as a custom symbol for Flot's point rendering. It draws a cross shape on the canvas at a specified location, given a drawing context, coordinate, radius, and shadow flag. The function can be referenced in the 'symbol' option for points and must match Flot's required symbol signature; it assumes the series will be rendered on a canvas supporting standard drawing commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
function cross(ctx, x, y, radius, shadow) {
    var size = radius * Math.sqrt(Math.PI) / 2;
    ctx.moveTo(x - size, y - size);
    ctx.lineTo(x + size, y + size);
    ctx.moveTo(x - size, y + size);
    ctx.lineTo(x + size, y - size);
}
```

TITLE: Creating Vertical Stripes in Flot Chart Background
DESCRIPTION: This function demonstrates how to create vertical stripes in the background of a Flot chart. It generates markings based on the x-axis range, creating alternating stripes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
markings: function (axes) {
    var markings = [];
    for (var x = Math.floor(axes.xaxis.min); x < axes.xaxis.max; x += 2)
        markings.push({ xaxis: { from: x, to: x + 1 } });
    return markings;
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Synchronous QUnit Test for Bootstrap Alert Component
DESCRIPTION: Example of a synchronous unit test for Bootstrap's alert component using QUnit. The test verifies that clicking the close button removes the 'show' class from the alert.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/js/tests/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Synchronous test
QUnit.test('should describe the unit being tested', function (assert) {
  assert.expect(1)
  var templateHTML = '
' +
        '×' +
        '
Template necessary for the test.
' +
        '
'
  var $alert = $(templateHTML).appendTo('#qunit-fixture').bootstrapAlert()

  $alert.find('.close').trigger('click')

  // Make assertion
  assert.strictEqual($alert.hasClass('show'), false, 'remove .show class on .close click')
})
```

TITLE: Data Transform Hook Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates implementing a processDatapoints hook that multiplies all y-coordinates by 2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_49

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function multiply(plot, series, datapoints) {
    var points = datapoints.points, ps = datapoints.pointsize;
    for (var i = 0; i < points.length; i += ps)
        points[i + 1] *= 2;
}
```

# angular-gantt

## Gantt chart component for AngularJS

angular-gantt provides a gantt chart component to your [AngularJS](https://angularjs.org/) application.


 

![angular-gantt](img/angular-gantt.png)

## Try now

Try angular-gantt now using the [Demo Application](http://www.angular-gantt.com/demo).

You can even try the API using [Plunker](http://plnkr.co/XYYkD8tf5b2LQs5kL5nx) sandbox (latest release).

Latest version is @@version

## Features
- Two-way data binding between model and view.
- Advanced calendar support to define holidays and working hours.
- Each task and row has its own properties and behavior.
- Rows and tasks can be sorted and filtered.
- Plugin architecture to add custom features and hooks.
- API to listen events and call methods from your controller.

TITLE: Capturing and Displaying a Callout using Liquid Template
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses Liquid templating to capture a note about browser limitations for range context queries and display it as a callout. It explains the workaround for min/max prefixes and fractional viewport widths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/_includes/callout-info-mediaqueries-breakpoints.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: liquid
CODE:
```
{% capture callout %}
Note that since browsers do not currently support [range context queries](https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-4/#range-context), we work around the limitations of [`min-` and `max-` prefixes](https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-4/#mq-min-max) and viewports with fractional widths (which can occur under certain conditions on high-dpi devices, for instance) by using values with higher precision for these comparisons.
{% endcapture %}
{% include callout.html content=callout type="info" %}
```

TITLE: Using Creation and Update Callbacks in Popper.js Instances - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to utilize the onCreate and onUpdate callbacks when constructing a new Popper instance. The code attaches functions to handle initialization and subsequent updates, where data represents the computed positioning information. It depends on Popper.js and is intended for clients needing hooks during popper lifecycle events. Inputs are DOM nodes and callback functions; outputs are user-defined side effects in callbacks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/popper.js/packages/popper/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const reference = document.querySelector('.my-button');
const popper = document.querySelector('.my-popper');
new Popper(reference, popper, {
    onCreate: (data) => {
        // data is an object containing all the informations computed
        // by Popper.js and used to style the popper and its arrow
        // The complete description is available in Popper.js documentation
    },
    onUpdate: (data) => {
        // same as `onCreate` but called on subsequent updates
    }
});
```

TITLE: Applying CSS Workaround for Safari Printing Bug
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet provides a workaround for a known rendering issue in Safari v8.0 and potentially newer versions when printing pages that use Bootstrap's fixed-width `.container` class. The issue causes Safari to use an unusually small font size. The workaround applies only during printing (`@media print`) and sets the `width` of the `.container` element to `auto`, preventing the font size problem.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/browsers-devices.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
@media print {
  .container {
    width: auto;
  }
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Custom Tick Generator for Pi Intervals in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This function generates ticks at intervals of pi, suitable for use on the x-axis of trigonometric function plots. It creates an array of tick values and labels, where each label is formatted as a multiple of pi.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/API.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function piTickGenerator(axis) {
  var res = [], i = Math.floor(axis.min / Math.PI);
  do {
    var v = i * Math.PI;
    res.push([v, i + "\u03c0"]);
    ++i;
  } while (v < axis.max);
  
  return res;
}
```

TITLE: Generating JavaScript Timestamp from DateTime in C#
DESCRIPTION: This C# method converts a System.DateTime object to a JavaScript timestamp (milliseconds since Unix epoch). It's useful for preparing time series data for Flot charts on the server-side.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/API.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public static int GetJavascriptTimestamp(System.DateTime input)
{
  System.TimeSpan span = new System.TimeSpan(System.DateTime.Parse("1/1/1970").Ticks);
  System.DateTime time = input.Subtract(span);
  return (long)(time.Ticks / 10000);
}
```

TITLE: Custom Suffix Formatter for Data Size Labels in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This function formats tick values with appropriate suffixes (B, kB, MB) based on the magnitude of the value. It's useful for displaying data sizes on axes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/Marti/flot/API.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function suffixFormatter(val, axis) {
  if (val > 1000000)
    return (val / 1000000).toFixed(axis.tickDecimals) + " MB";
  else if (val > 1000)
    return (val / 1000).toFixed(axis.tickDecimals) + " kB";
  else
    return val.toFixed(axis.tickDecimals) + " B";
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Axis Options in Flot Charts (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the available options for customizing axes in Flot charts. It includes settings for visibility, positioning, scaling, ticks, and formatting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
xaxis, yaxis: {
    show: null or true/false
    position: "bottom" or "top" or "left" or "right"
    mode: null or "time" ("time" requires jquery.flot.time.js plugin)
    timezone: null, "browser" or timezone (only makes sense for mode: "time")

    color: null or color spec
    tickColor: null or color spec
    font: null or font spec object

    min: null or number
    max: null or number
    autoscaleMargin: null or number
    
    transform: null or fn: number -> number
    inverseTransform: null or fn: number -> number
    
    ticks: null or number or ticks array or (fn: axis -> ticks array)
    tickSize: number or array
    minTickSize: number or array
    tickFormatter: (fn: number, object -> string) or string
    tickDecimals: null or number

TITLE: Implementing Debug Plugin for Flot in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This comprehensive example demonstrates a debug plugin for Flot. It includes initialization, option handling, and hook usage. The plugin alerts series information based on a debug level option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/PLUGINS.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
(function ($) {
    function init(plot) {
        var debugLevel = 1;

        function checkDebugEnabled(plot, options) {
            if (options.debug) {
                debugLevel = options.debug;
                plot.hooks.processDatapoints.push(alertSeries);
            }
        }

        function alertSeries(plot, series, datapoints) {
            var msg = "series " + series.label;
            if (debugLevel > 1) {
                msg += " with " + series.data.length + " points";
                alert(msg);
            }
        }

        plot.hooks.processOptions.push(checkDebugEnabled);
    }

    var options = { debug: 0 };
      
    $.plot.plugins.push({
        init: init,
        options: options,
        name: "simpledebug",
        version: "0.1"
    });
})(jQuery);
```

TITLE: Creating Custom Tick Generator for Pi Intervals in Flot (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This function generates ticks at intervals of pi, suitable for trigonometric functions on the x-axis in Flot charts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
function piTickGenerator(axis) {
    var res = [], i = Math.floor(axis.min / Math.PI);
    do {
        var v = i * Math.PI;
        res.push([v, i + "\u03c0"]);
        ++i;
    } while (v < axis.max);
    return res;
}
```

TITLE: Handling Click Events in Flot Chart
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to handle click events in a Flot chart. It shows how to bind a click event listener and access the clicked position and item data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
$.plot($("#placeholder"), [ d ], { grid: { clickable: true } });

$("#placeholder").bind("plotclick", function (event, pos, item) {
    alert("You clicked at " + pos.x + ", " + pos.y);
    // axis coordinates for other axes, if present, are in pos.x2, pos.x3, ...
    // if you need global screen coordinates, they are pos.pageX, pos.pageY

    if (item) {
        highlight(item.series, item.datapoint);
        alert("You clicked a point!");
    }
});
```

TITLE: Creating Responsive Utilities using Bootstrap Sass Breakpoint Loops (SCSS)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates generating responsive text alignment utility classes (e.g., `.text-md-left`, `.text-lg-center`). It uses a Sass `@each` loop to iterate through the keys of the `$grid-breakpoints` map. For each breakpoint, it generates corresponding text alignment classes wrapped in the appropriate media query using the `media-breakpoint-up` mixin and calculates the class infix (like `-md-`) using the `breakpoint-infix` function. Depends on the `$grid-breakpoints` map and associated mixins/functions within Bootstrap.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
@each $breakpoint in map-keys($grid-breakpoints) {
  @include media-breakpoint-up($breakpoint) {
    $infix: breakpoint-infix($breakpoint, $grid-breakpoints);

    .text#{$infix}-left   { text-align: left !important; }
    .text#{$infix}-right  { text-align: right !important; }
    .text#{$infix}-center { text-align: center !important; }
  }
}
```

TITLE: Mocking Popper.js for Jest Tests
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to mock Popper.js for use in Jest tests. It provides two methods: creating a mock file in __mocks__ directory, and manually mocking Popper.js for a specific test. Both methods create a simplified Popper class with placements and basic methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/popper.js/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import PopperJs from 'popper.js';

export default class Popper {
  static placements = PopperJs.placements;

  constructor() {
    return {
      destroy: () => {},
      scheduleUpdate: () => {},
    };
  }
}
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
jest.mock('popper.js', () => {
  const PopperJS = jest.requireActual('popper.js');

  return class Popper {
    static placements = PopperJS.placements;

    constructor() {
      return {
        destroy: () => {},
        scheduleUpdate: () => {},
      };
    }
  };
});
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-cluster/ManualClusterGuide.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd $CLUSTER_HOME_DIR/deployments/helm/ helm upgrade --install -n takserver takserver src/takserver-cluster/deployments/helm -f src/takserver-cluster/deployments/helm/developer-values.yaml --set takserver.plugins.enabled={REPLICA_COUNT} --set takserver.messaging.replicas={REPLICA_COUNT} --set takserver.api.replicas={REPLICA_COUNT} --set takserver.messaging.image.repository=AWS_ECR_URI --set takserver.api.image.repository=AWS_ECR_URI --set takserver.plugins.image.repository=AWS_ECR_URI --set ignite.replicaCount={REPLICA_COUNT} --set nats.cluster.replicas={REPLICA_COUNT} --set stan.cluster.replicas={REPLICA_COUNT}
```

TITLE: Defining Native Font Stack in Sass for Bootstrap
DESCRIPTION: This Sass snippet defines the default font stack used in Bootstrap 4. It includes system fonts for various operating systems and fallback options for wide compatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/content/reboot.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sass
CODE:
```
$font-family-sans-serif:
  // Safari for macOS and iOS (San Francisco)
  -apple-system,
  // Chrome < 56 for macOS (San Francisco)
  BlinkMacSystemFont,
  // Windows
  "Segoe UI",
  // Android
  "Roboto",
  // Basic web fallback
  "Helvetica Neue", Arial, sans-serif,
  // Emoji fonts
  "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", "Segoe UI Symbol" !default;
```

Outputs: Modifier parses and applies positional offset to the popper. Limitation: Arithmetic only supports addition and subtraction; multiplication/division not allowed.

'10%'
'10, 10'
'10%, 10'

'10 - 5vh + 3%'
'-10px + 5vh, 5px - 6%'
```

TITLE: Registering Popper.js Lifecycle Callbacks - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates a Popper.js instance with custom 'onCreate' and 'onUpdate' callback functions. It uses const to bind reference and popper elements, then provides an options object containing two callbacks invoked at different lifecycle stages: 'onCreate' fires after initialization, while 'onUpdate' executes after subsequent updates. Both receive a 'data' parameter with Popper.js state and computed styles. No external dependencies except Popper.js, and the snippet expects DOM nodes with correct class selectors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/popper.js/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
const reference = document.querySelector('.my-button');\nconst popper = document.querySelector('.my-popper');\nnew Popper(reference, popper, {\n  onCreate: data => {\n    // data is an object containing all the informations computed\n    // by Popper.js and used to style the popper and its arrow\n    // The complete description is available in Popper.js documentation\n  },\n  onUpdate: data => {\n    // same as `onCreate` but called on subsequent updates\n  },\n});
```

TITLE: Including Accessibility Warning Callout in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to include a warning callout about color usage and accessibility in an HTML template. It uses Liquid templating to capture the content and then includes it using a custom callout component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/_includes/callout-warning-color-assistive-technologies.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
{% capture callout %}
##### Conveying meaning to assistive technologies

Using color to add meaning only provides a visual indication, which will not be conveyed to users of assistive technologies – such as screen readers. Ensure that information denoted by the color is either obvious from the content itself (e.g. the visible text), or is included through alternative means, such as additional text hidden with the `.sr-only` class.
{% endcapture %}
{% include callout.html content=callout type="warning" %}
```

TITLE: Applying Screen Reader Styles using SCSS Mixins
DESCRIPTION: This SCSS snippet shows how to apply screen reader accessibility styles using Sass mixins. The `@include sr-only;` mixin hides an element visually but keeps it available to screen readers, while `@include sr-only-focusable;` makes the element visible when focused. This example applies these styles to a custom `.skip-navigation` class. It requires a Sass environment and a framework or library providing these specific mixins.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/takserver-core/src/main/webapp/user-management/bower_components/bootstrap/site/docs/4.3/utilities/screen-readers.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// Usage as a mixin
.skip-navigation {
  @include sr-only;
  @include sr-only-focusable;
}
```

TITLE: C# Timestamp Generation
DESCRIPTION: Method to generate JavaScript-compatible timestamps in C# by calculating ticks since Unix epoch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tak-product-center/server/blob/main/src/federation-hub-ui/src/main/webapp/bowerDependencies/flot/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
public static int GetJavascriptTimestamp(System.DateTime input)
{
    System.TimeSpan span = new System.TimeSpan(System.DateTime.Parse("1/1/1970").Ticks);
    System.DateTime time = input.Subtract(span);
    return (long)(time.Ticks / 10000);
}
```
